title: Please Buff Nautilus' Size
body:
I remember the very first time I saw Nautilus{{champion:111}}  in LOL. He was a humongous and towering figure; arguably, the biggest champion in the entire game. This seemed appropriate, considering his overall strength in-game, and the fact that his lore even mentions him donning his "hulking diver's suit." 
     But when I look at Nautilus{{champion:111}}  today, he really seems to be lacking his grim and threatening image. His size has been significantly reduced over time and now matches the height of many other non-tanky champions. I find this change to be saddening and I feel that it's taking away from his true power. He seems like a mere flea in comparison to other tanks such as Sion{{champion:14}} , Zach{{champion:154}} , and  fully stacked cho' gath{{champion:31}}.  I would love nothing more than to see his size increase to fit other members of his class and to better showcase his titan-like strength over his squishier foes. This is shown perfectly in the "New Dawn" cinematic, with his grand entrance and massive girth. Not to mention the fact that other champions had to literally look up to meet his eyes.

This wouldn't be a buff nor a nerf. Just a simple visual update to show both champions and summoners exactly what they're dealing with when they battle toe-to-toe with "The Titan of the Depths."

This is an awesome idea *thematically*, but what about *technically*? Nautilus is meant to be this massive lumbering juggernaut, but increasing his size will also come with some technical changes.

His Dredge Line, for example. If they simply increased his model size that would mean his anchor would be larger as well. Yet when he throws his Q around, it would end up looking smaller. But if they increased the projectile size of his anchor, that would mean increasing its hitbox size, which could have an unknown effect on his balance and gameplay. And what about his Riptide? In order to fit his new size it would need a buff to its visual and hitbox range as well.

It's mainly a matter of perception. If they were to increase his increase his hit box, he would be more likely to be hit by skillshots, which would make him take more damage and could be considered a nerf. But {{champion:111}}  is also very durable and it probably wouldn't have that negative of an impact on players. He would be able to soak up more damage in teamfights which could be considered a buff. But you should also consider champions like {{champion:154}}  and {{champion:31}} , who are able to change their sizes mid-game. The changes to their abilities are barley noticed. Overall I doubt it would be anything game breaking.

As far as his Q goes. {{champion:111}} throws his anchor "vertically" not "horizontally." so any cosmetic changes to the width of his anchor would not affect the ability.

I think Riot only (somewhat) recently decided that "tanky" champions should have significantly larger models and hitboxes than others, so new tank champions (Braum, Mega Gnar) and reworked tank champions (Sion) are pretty gigantic compared to a lot of other champions. Nautilus definitely should be brought to the same size, but they might be planning to do so alongside a rework (hopefully a small one, he could use some love but I think a lot of his kit is fine).
